data.title: Every TV shows and film coming to Netflix, HBO Max, Amazon Prime and Hulu in April
data.meta_description: It has been a year since the coronavirus pandemic broke out and none of us could have predicted what was yet to come. With April Fool's Day right around the corner, spring ope
data.text:
It has been a year since the coronavirus pandemic broke out and none of us could have predicted what was yet to come. With April Fool's Day right around the corner, spring opens its doors to countless new streaming options. Netflix navigates us through a new cycle of 'Too Hot to Handle' and 'The Circle', introducing us to its new scheduling strategy. HBO Max will be releasing the new super rated-R 'Mortal Kombat' starring Kate Winslet who has come a long way from 'Titanic'.

Hulu will welcome back its most popular original series in April, along with a trio of buzz-worthy documentaries and some '90s movie favourites. The streaming service also has a few high-profile documentaries such as 'WeWork: Or the Making and Breaking of a $47 Billion Unicorn' (April 2), whose title is pretty self-explanatory; 'Hysterical' (April 3), which profiles female stand-up comics and streams a day after it airs on FX; and 'Sasquatch' (April 20), a three-part series produced by the Duplass brothers investigating whether Bigfoot killed three Northern California pot growers in 1993.

Meanwhile, Disney + will debut the John Stamos basketball dramedy 'Big Shot', which is sure to get the whole family emotional.

What is coming out on Netflix in April 2021?

Netflix is releasing a slew of new stuff in April, including the return of a reality hit and a much-anticipated new fantasy series.

That would be 'Shadow and Bone' (April 23), the series adaptation of the hugely popular YA novels from Leigh Bardugo. Jessie Mei Li stars as Alina, an orphan in a war-torn country who discovers she has mystical powers that could change the fate of her world.

What will be new to Hulu in April 2021?

It's been quite a while since the last season of 'Handmaid's Tale' arrived on Hulu. Luckily, the wait for season four is almost over. The first three episodes of the new season will arrive on April 28, and new episodes will land on Wednesdays. Season four will consist of 10 episodes. A revolution is brewing with June becoming the figurehead against Gilead, and the latest trailer looks pretty intense.

What series are coming to Amazon Prime this April?

Amazon Prime Video's newest original series will dive into a different kind of American horror story. 'THEM' is an anthology show that will explore a new story each season and, based on the trailer, the first appears to combine elements of 'Lovecraft Country' as it follows the unsettling experiences of a Black family that moves into an all-white L.A. suburb in the 1950s.

What's new on Disney+?

In April 2021, Disney+ will welcome new episodes of its original series, a new wave of movies and TV shows, from the realms of Star Wars, Disney Channel, and more.

This month, Disney+ will see a couple of old-school titles from the Star Wars universe, movies from both Disney and Fox, and a new sports drama-comedy TV show starring John Stamos.

What can I watch on IMDb TV?

Yes, there are fewer titles coming to IMDb TV in April than there were in March. However, there's still more than one movie a day to watch, giving you plenty to keep you entertained when there's nothing on elsewhere.

The original true-crime documentary from IMDb TV makes its debut on IMDb this April. 'Moment of Truth' chronicles the murder of James Jordan, the father of basketball star Michael Jordan. Two teenagers in North Carolina were convicted, but the doc focuses on the corruption and politics within the county, as well as issues of evidence.
